data.title: H. Joan Lough Obituary
data.meta_description: Obituary for H. Joan Lough | H. Joan Lough, 95, of Avilla and previously of Big Long Lake and New Haven, passed away peacefully at Sacred Heart Nursing Home, on Friday, January 5, 2024. She was a 50 plus year member of The...
data.meta_site_name: H. Joan Lough Obituary | January 5, 2024 | Harper Funeral Homes - Avilla, IN
data.text:
H. Joan Lough, 95, of Avilla and previously of Big Long Lake and New Haven, passed away peacefully at Sacred Heart Nursing Home, on Friday, January 5, 2024. She was a 50 plus year member of The Order of The Eastern Star, Waynedale Chapter #600, and retired from Chronister Pharmacy in Kendallville.

She is survived by sons Mike Lough of St Petersburg, Florida, and Tom Lough of Monroeville; daughter Nancy (Marian Thibeau) Lough of Albion; sister Virginia “Ginny” Roberts of Auburn; grandson Evan Lough of Monroeville; and sister-in-law Ellen Jane Luellen of Fort Wayne.

She is proceeded in death by her husband of 55 years, Gordon “Wimp” Lough, son-in-law Dennis Fieber, daughter-in-law Linda Lough, 4 brothers, and 3 sisters.

Service will be 3:00pm, Wednesday, January 10, 2024, at Harper Funeral Home, Avilla Chapel, 530 N Main St, Avilla with visitation from 1:00 until time of service. Burial will be at Covington Memorial Gardens, in Fort Wayne.

In lieu of flowers, memorials in Joan’s memory may be made to Noble County Humane Society.

You may send a condolence or sign the on-line register book by visiting: www.harperfuneralhomes.com
